title: Package Open layout
custom_preconds:
As a club user, I want to be able to view the details of a package that has been uploaded to the MUT.

https://app.zeplin.io/project/61e03b07b772c063c82a2b3c/screen/61e03c3a19c9a1b9fad07f79#
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to the DEV site: https://mutdev.mlb.com/packages/mlb

2. Click on any package name
custom_expected:
On L viewports:

- Clicking/tapping on a row slides the Package Open rail out from the right side

- Fields appear

- X to close the rail

- Date and title (title is editable)

- Uploaded by details (not editable)

- Uploaded date (not editable)

- Metadata (editable)

- Notes (editable)

- Buttons to "Download All Files" of the files in that package, to "Add Files" to that package and to "Delete Package" (active)

- File count, download icon (inactive until at least 1 file is selected), delete button (inactive until at least 1 file is selected)

On M and S viewports:

- Clicking/tapping on the row opens the Package Open rail above the Package list

- Fields appear

- Back arrow, that when clicked/tapped, closes the rail

- Date and title (title is editable)

- Uploaded by details (not editable)

- Uploaded date (not editable)

- Metadata (editable)

- Notes (editable)

- Buttons to "Download All Files" of the files in that package, to "Add Files" to that package and to "Delete Package" (active)

- File count, download icon (inactive until at least 1 file is selected), delete button (inactive until at least 1 file is selected)

- Button to delete the package entirely

title: Delete Package & Files functionalities
custom_preconds: As a club user, I want to delete files and packages I have uploaded to the Media Upload Tool. I do not want these files and/or packages to remain on MLB Pressbox.
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to URL: https://mutdev.mlb.com/packages/mlb
2. When a user clicks/taps on a Trash can or a Delete button
custom_expected:
- The modal to Delete a Package or Delete File(s) should display in the center of the viewable area
- Deleting the file/package removes it from the UI and GCS
- If the user deletes an entire package, it should no longer display on MLB Pressbox

title: Delete Files modal layout
custom_preconds:
As a club user, I want to delete content I have uploaded.
Login to the site and proceed to open a package file
custom_steps:
If deleting individual file(s), display the Delete File(s) modal: https://zpl.io/29915Qy. 

1. Navigate to URL: https://mutdev.mlb.com/packages/mlb

2. Select file(s) from the Package Open sidebar

2. Click/tap the trash can

3. A modal appears in the center of the viewable area including:

- Delete File(s) heading

- X to close modal

- Are you sure messaging

- List of a file(s) to be deleted

- Delete & Cancel buttons

4. Upon successful delete, show Deleted messaging
custom_expected:
A modal appears in the center of the viewable area including:
- Delete File(s) heading, 
- X to close modal
- Are you sure messaging
- List of a file(s) to be deleted
- Delete & Cancel buttons
Upon successful delete, show Deleted messaging

title: Delete Package modal layout
custom_preconds:
As a club user, I want to delete content I have uploaded.
Login to the site and proceed to the open a package
custom_steps:
If deleting entire package(s), display the Delete Package(s) modal: https://zpl.io/aXpJW8K. 
1. Navigate to URL: https://mutdev.mlb.com/packages/mlb
2. To do this, user needs to select file(s) from Packages table
3. User can select one or multiple packages
4. Clicking/tapping the trash can above the table opens this modal
custom_expected:
Modal appears in the center of the viewable area including:
- Contains Delete Package(s) heading, X to close modal
- Are you sure messaging
- List of the package(s) to be deleted
- Delete & Cancel buttons
Upon successful delete, show Deleted messaging

title: Homepage layout
custom_preconds:
As a media upload tool user, I need a place in the media upload tool where I can see and access everything I may need to do my job.

https://zpl.io/a8dv6WJ

Refer to both Zeplin and the attached Breakpoints as your guides
custom_steps:
On viewports 769 and bigger, (L in the mocks) the following appear:

- Header bar with button to view all packages, help link, Admin button, MLB Batter logo

- Left column with button to upload a new package, organization logo you are a part of (club, mlb, mlbn), mailboxes PRESSBOX (public), MLB NETWORK (private), Deleted/Expired files

Main column with table:

- Above table, display Download icon and Delete (trash can icon). Both are inactive unless a selection has been made in a checkbox in the table

- Table headers: Checkbox (to select all), Package, Uploaded by, Size, File(s), Upload (with option to sort by date), Received

On viewports, 768 and smaller (M & S in the mocks):

- Hamburger & MLB Batter logo

- Packages heading

- Left column content moves into dropdown menu

- Package count

- Condensed view of table contents

- Headers are removed

- Plus button to upload a new package
custom_expected:
- On viewports 769 and bigger, (L in the mocks) the following should display:

 Header bar with button to view all packages, help link, Admin button, MLB Batter logo

- Left column with button to upload a new package, organization logo you are a part of (club, mlb, mlbn), mailboxes PRESSBOX (public), MLB NETWORK (private), Deleted/Expired files

Main column with table should include:

- Above table, display Download icon and Delete (trash can icon). Both are inactive unless a selection has been made in a checkbox in the table

- Table headers: Checkbox (to select all), Package, Uploaded by, Size, File(s), Upload (with option to sort by date), Received

On viewports, 768 and smaller (M & S in the mocks), the following should display:

- Hamburger & MLB Batter logo

- Packages heading

- Left column content moves into dropdown menu

- Package count

- Condensed view of table contents

- Headers are removed

- Plus button to upload a new package

title: Upload Package modal layout
custom_preconds:
As someone at the club, I want to be able to add files (packages) to the media upload tool.
Zeplin: https://zpl.io/2y50BEw
custom_steps:
1. Login to the site

2. Clicking/tapping New Package button opens modal where user can upload files
custom_expected:
Modal appears in center of viewable area

Modal includes:

- New Package heading

- X to close modal

- Mandatory text field for title ("Name")

- Mandatory checkboxes to choose destination ("Upload Package To")

- Text field for Metadata

- Text field for (Notes)

- Field to browse/drag a file

- Send button (inactive until title has been filled in and at least 1 file has been attached)

- Once at least 1 file has been attached, display the details of that file below the Browse bar 

Cancel button, always active

Upon successful upload, Saved message appears & uploaded file appears in table.

title: Upload Package functionality
custom_preconds:
As a club user, I want to be able to upload packages and files to MUT. 
I want those files to be available on MLB Pressbox for download.
custom_steps: 1. When user click/taps New Package button, or the :plus: on smaller viewports, the modal to upload a package displays
custom_expected:
- Clicking/tapping the Browse button opens their device’s Insert File/finder situation

- Selected packages appear as a list below the Browse

- Send button becomes/ moves to an Active state only when all mandatory fields have been filled in

- Clicking/tapping "Send" adds the package to GCS to the bucket you are currently signed in to

- File appears in the MUT table as the last file on the list

title: Club logos
custom_preconds: As a PO, I want to display consistent team branding throughout my sites and the Media Upload Tool.
custom_steps: - Logos come from this Cloudinary endpoint: https://img.mlbstatic.com/mlb-photos/image/upload/f_svg/v1/team/140/logo/current
custom_expected:
- Logo appears on page and in the dropdown
- If no logo, fallback to MLB placeholder image

title: Create Users and Permission
custom_preconds: To allow our application to grant access to users since we are using the public okta tenant we will need to have our users maintained in the system as well as the roles they are associated to
custom_steps:
1. Create a table to maintain the users information 

- Email (required)

- First Name (required)

- Last Name (required)

- Team ID (maintain a list of teams in the system) - Teams will be (MLB teams, MLB Nework, MLB)

2. Create a table of roles for the system (Each role will be inclusive so every one will have basic, then from there admin will be also added)

4. Create a user_role_mappings table including:

- user_id

- role_id

5. Create backend services to maintain these users and roles:

- create new user

- update user

6. Create an admin UI screen to list the users, create new users, update a user
custom_expected:
The following tables should be created:

Create a table to maintain the users information including: 

- Email (required)

- First Name (required)

- Last Name (required)

- Team ID (maintain a list of teams in the system) - Teams will be (MLB teams, MLB Nework, MLB)

Create a table of roles for the system (Each role will be inclusive so every one will have basic, then from there admin will be also added)

Create a user_role_mappings table including:

- user_id

- role_id

Create backend services to maintain these users and roles:

- create new user

- update user

Create an admin UI screen to list the users, create new users, update a user

title: Additional metadata fields
custom_preconds: As a club user, I need to communicate important metadata to MLB Network about files I am uploading.
custom_steps:
Additional metadata fields are added to the modal. 

Fields are mandatory when sent to Network (private)

1. If metadata is missing from a field, do not allow user to save content

2. Mandatory Fields when sending to Network (private) are:
  - Title
  - Standalone blurb
  - Title/headline
  - Big blurb

Mandatory fields when sending to Pressbox (public) are:
  - Title

"The message field is not mandatory for either use case"
custom_expected:
- Additional metadata fields are added to the modal. 

- Fields are mandatory when sent to Network (private)
If metadata is missing from a field, do not allow user to save content
Mandatory Fields when sending to Network (private) are:
  Title
  Standalone blurb
  Title/headline
  Big blurb
Mandatory fields when sending to Pressbox (public) are:
  Title

-The message field is not mandatory for either use case

title: Download Package
custom_preconds: We want to be able to download a package which will return a zip file of the files associated with that package
custom_expected:
Download:

add a get url under the path /api/package/{packageId}/download

this url will return the zip of the files we associated with the package

the zip will be named the title of the package .zip

title: View Package
custom_preconds: We want to be able to view a package which will return all the metadata associated with that package and signed ulrs for the files
custom_expected:
Add a get url under the path `/api/package/{packageId}` 
this url will return a packageDTO with the associated metadata and the files with a signed url

title: Download Package from UI
custom_preconds: From the UI Package screen I want to be able to download a package.
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to URL: https://mutdev.mlb.com/packages/mlb
2. Select one or more rows
3. Click "Download" button
custom_expected:
-Package should download by the table actions
-Multiple packages should be downloaded by using the table row selections and the buttons above

title: Display team code in URL
custom_preconds: As a user with multiple permissions, I want to be able to quickly hit a URL to see certain content.
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to URL: https://mutdev.mlb.com/
2. Under "Packages" tab, select any team from the dropdown
custom_expected:
- Team abbreviation appears in the URL of the page being viewed
EX: if viewing Washington Nationals, /wsh appears in the URL
MLB should be /mlb
MLB Network should be /mlbn

- Team abbreviation matches abbreviations on MLB Pressbox
- Hitting a URL with a team abbreviation appended directs user to that page in the Media Upload Tool

title: Upload Modal: Last Modified & Size display update
custom_preconds: As a MUT user, I want an accurate display of the size and the date my file was last modified presented to me.
custom_expected:
Last Modified displays the date the file was modified
Size displays the actual file size

title: Logout
custom_preconds: As a PO, I want users to be able to log out of the Media Upload Tool.
custom_expected:
Clicking/tapping Logout logs the user out of the Media Upload Tool.

All cookies are deleted

Clicking/tapping the back button on their browser forces the user to log in again

title: Assign number ID to Media Assets
custom_preconds:
As somoene at a club, I want a number assigned to each asset I upload. 
I want to be able to reference this number on both pressbox and in the mut table.
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to URL: https://mutdev.mlb.com
2. Click/tap on a row to open the "Package rail out from the right side
3. "Add Files" modal should display
4. Click on "Save" and you can see the files are uploaded
custom_expected:
-Each asset is assigned a unique ID number
-Numbers start at 50000 and increment by 1 with each upload
-Deleting an asset does not reassign that ID number

title: Add MLB Pressbox footer
custom_preconds: As a PO, I want users to be able to quickly access links to Help and our terms.
custom_expected:
Footer seen on MLB Pressbox is added to Media Upload Tool
Pinned to the bottom of the page

title: Admin - allow for multiple team assignement
custom_preconds: As an admin, I want to be able to assign users to multiple teams.
custom_expected:
Multi-select function is added to the Team dropdown
Admins are able to assign multiple Organizations to users
Users added to multiple organizations see all Organizations in the Homepage dropdown

title: Add MUT icon and link to mobile
custom_preconds: As a Club PR Person, I want to be able to quickly access the Media Upload Tool on my mobile device so I can upload files that will display on MLB Pressbox.
custom_expected:
Upload icon is added to header, appears between Pressbox URL mark and logout icon
Clicking/tapping link opens the Media Upload tool in a new tab

title: Send assets to Pressbox/ Multimedia
custom_preconds: As a MUT uploader, I want to send some content to MLB Pressbox.
custom_expected:
- If Pressbox (Public) is selected in the New Package modal: 
Send that content to the corresponding Multimedia table on MLB Pressbox
All content goes to the Multimedia landing page on the Portal site.
Club content goes to that club’s Multimedia landing page.
EX: Content uploaded by Baltimore would appear at https://www.mlbpressbox.com/bal/multimedia
Content appears in the Pressbox (Public) table in the MUT

- Content uploaded to mutdev.mlb.com appears on https://dev-gcp.mlbpressbox.com/multimedia 
Portal and Club sites
- Content uploaded to mut.mlb.com appears on https://beta.mlbpressbox.com/multimedia and https://www.mlbpressbox.com/multimedia
Portal and Club sites

title: Pressbox | MUT - Replace desktop Media Upload Tool link
custom_preconds:
As a Club PR person, I want to be able to quickly access the MLB Media Upload Tool from MLB Pressbox.
Link is replaced with new MUT link
custom_steps:
1. Go to the following site:
https://dev-gcp.mlbpressbox.com/nyy
https://dev-gcp.mlbpressbox.com
and verify the Media Upload tool icon is displayed and is functional.
custom_expected: -Clicking the icon should direct the user to the new MUT link

title: Footer - Implement footer design
custom_preconds: As a PO, I want the MUT to have a footer with basic copyright information.
custom_steps: 1. Navigate to the following URL: https://mutdev.mlb.com/
custom_expected:
-Footer designs are implemented
https://app.zeplin.io/project/61e03b07b772c063c82a2b3c/screen/61e03c3a19c9a1b9fad07f79
Does not need social icons - just copyright info
Appears on all pages of all viewports
Copyright year is dynamic
Users should not need to change the year every January 1

title: Create Pressbox MiLB Downloads Admin Screen
custom_preconds: As an admin, I want to be able to go to the Admin screen for Pressbox downloads and update the metadata associations.
custom_steps:
Create 3 types of fields for Pressbox MiLB Downloads (Type, Category, Sub Category)
3 separate tables pressbox_milb_download_types, pressbox_milb_download_category, pressbox_milb_download_sub_category
Categories need to be associated to a type
Sub_category needs to be tied to the category
This page should have 3 sections one for each type
Webpack App
Each value should be editable
these values can be in a data table or an array of cards whatever the developer thinks is best
An add new button should be in each section to add a new one

![](index.php?/attachments/get/13404371)

title: Create Upload Type for MiLB Downloads
custom_preconds: As an admin, I want to be able to assign the MiLB Licensing team to a group that allows them to upload content to the MiLB downloads section of MLB Pressbox.
custom_expected:
New Upload Type, MiLB Downloads, is created
Users assigned to this upload type can upload content to MiLB downloads

title: New Package - MiLB Downloads Type modal modifications
custom_preconds: As someone uploading assets to the MiLB Download section of Pressbox, I only want to fill in information pertinent to my file.
custom_expected:
MiLB Downloads is added to the Upload to dropdown
User should be able to select a club and a type from the dropdowns, add their file(s)
User should not need to name the file(s) being uploaded; all should be driven off the dropdowns and free text field described below
Three dropdowns are added in the MiLB Downloads metadata section
Type (required)
Category (required)
Sub Category
A free text 
field is also stored on the metadata object.
The package title will be updated for the user, displayed but not editable
The title will be made up of a string of {Category} {Sub Category} {Free Text}

title: Add Download Type Column to Packages Homepage
Admin-Sorting

As an uploader, I want to choose the order that Download assets appear on MLB Pressbox. I want to be able to sort via the Admin page of the media upload tool.
Must be on the https://mut.mlb.com/admin/pressbox/downloads site location
custom_steps:
1. Click "Admin" tab
2. Select "Pressbox Downloads
custom_expected:
- Sort logic is added so a user can drag & drop
- Download Type, Download Categories, and Download Sub-Categories are able to be sorted

title: Admin-Convert Pressbox Downloads tiles to list
custom_preconds: As an admin, I want the Pressbox Downloads page to be really easy to read and digest.
custom_steps:
Click "Admin" tab
Select "Pressbox Downloads
custom_expected: Tiles are converted to table

title: New Package-MiLB Downloads Type modal modifications
custom_preconds: As someone uploading assets to the MiLB Download section of Pressbox, I only want to fill in information pertinent to my file.
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to  URL: https://mutdev.mlb.com/packages/mlb
2. Click on "New Package"

-MiLB Downloads is added to the Upload to dropdown

-User should be able to select a club and a type from the dropdowns, add their file(s)

-User should not need to name the file(s) being uploaded; all should be driven off the dropdowns and free text field described below

-Three dropdowns are added in the MiLB Downloads metadata section

Type (required)

Category (required)

Sub Category

A free text 

field is also stored on the metadata object.

-The package title will be updated for the user, displayed but not editable

-The title will be made up of a string of {Category} {Sub Category} {Free Text}
custom_expected:
MiLB Downloads is added to the Upload to dropdown (“Pressbox MiLB Downloads” is added to the “Upload Types” (under New Group/Edit Group) and under the New Package > Upload Package To) 

User should be able to select a club and a type from the dropdowns, add their file(s) 

User should not need to name the file(s) being uploaded; all should be driven off the dropdowns and free text field described below

Three dropdowns are added in the MiLB Downloads metadata section (When Minor League Baseball is selected in Download Type, then three section as below are displayed)

Type (required) - “Download Type” is displayed instead of Type

Category (required) - “Download Category” is displayed instead of Category

Sub Category - “Download Sub-Category” is displayed instead of Sub Category 

A free text - “Download Name Free Text” is displayed instead of ‘Free Text’

field is also stored on the metadata object.

The package title will be updated for the user - User clicking on the Name field, I’m able to Edit)

The title will be made up of a string of {Category} {Sub Category} {Free Text}

title: MLB Pressbox/Downloads-Remove from file extension & put all on single line
MLB Pressbox- Verify Proxima Nova font family appears throughout the site
MLB Pressbox-Multimedia-Match site styling
custom_preconds:
As a fan, I want the multimedia table to be easy to read.

As a PO, I want the multimedia table to match the styling of the rest of the site
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to URL: https://dev-gcp.mlbpressbox.com/multimedia
2. To test the styling, right click on any font on the Multimedia table, click "Inspect" and under "Styles" verify the correct font style is displayed under "body" next to "Font Family". (attached screenshot)
custom_expected:
-Fonts and styling matches other tables on the site

EX: Game Notes Archive: https://www.mlbpressbox.com/archive/game-notes

-line-height, font-weight, height are adjusted (speficially)

-Only Date column contents are bold

-Verified on both MLB Pressbox and Club Pressbox sites

-Shipped to PROD with next Pressbox release

-2022 section/page is cloned and 2023 data appears

Press Releases

-Section

Spring Training Statistics

https://dapi.mlbinfra.com/v2/content/en-us/sel-pressbox-spring-training-statistics-2023

title: Pressbox/Multimedia-Remove "Device Not Supported" modal
custom_preconds: We do not need to display a warning to users anymore that their device isn’t supported when accessing /multimedia.
custom_steps: 1.Test on a mobile device while connected to the MLB VPN and ensured that a ‘Device Not Supported’ Modal does not appear.
custom_expected:
-The Device Not Supported modal does not fire when a user accesses /multimedia from a mobile device or tablet

Removed from MLB Pressbox Multimedia and Club Pressbox Multimedia

Removed from all environments: QA (if available, DEV, BETA, and PROD

Verified on lower environments

-Must be tested on a physical device

Shipped to PROD with next MLB Pressbox release

Verified on PROD after release on physical devices

title: MUT-Send Packages to Pressbox as .ZIP

-All files in a package are sent to the MLB Pressbox/Club Pressbox multimedia table as a zipped file

-Package Name displays in the Title field in the Pressbox multimedia table

-Clicking/tapping the row from the multimedia table downloads a zip file

title: Pressbox Downloads - Sorting by Download Type does not sort column
